column1: Title: "PrEP coverage and number of persons prescribed | 2017 | 2018 | 2019 | United States | All races/ethnicities | Female | Male | Ages 13 years and older | All transmission categories"

column3: is calculated as the number of persons aged ≥16 years classified as having been prescribed PrEP divided by the estimated number of persons aged ≥16 years who had indications for PrEP. Number prescribed
column5: is defined as the number of persons aged ≥16 years classified as having been prescribed PrEP during the specified year and includes all FDA-approved drugs for PrEP. “Population” is the annual estimated number of persons with PrEP indications. Total includes people categorized by IQVIA as Black
column8: or Other race. Race/ethnicity data are adjusted due to large proportion of missing race/ethnicity. To allow for comparison with other HIV indicators
column11: respectively. Number prescribed are reported through June 2022
